excerpt: The ruins of this ancient citadel on a steep cliff with sea views can be reached by foot or donkey.
detail_description: Lindos Acropolis is an ancient citadel located on a steep cliff with stunning sea views. It offers a glimpse into prehistoric sites such as the nearby Acropolis of Lindos and Rhodes, along with ancient Minoan artifacts dating back over 3,000 years. Nature lovers can explore the Valley of Butterflies and enjoy miles of sunny beaches.
name: Lindos Acropolis

excerpt: Lindos is a town on the Greek island of Rhodes. It’s known for its clifftop acropolis, which features monumental 4th-century gates and reliefs from about 280 B.C. The Temple of Athena Lindia sits above an earlier temple. On the site’s lower level is the 14th-century Castle of the Knights of St. John. Among the town’s whitewashed buildings, the Virgin Mary of Lindos Church has 15th-century frescoes.
detail_description: Lindos, a charming town on the Greek island of Rhodes, is steeped in history and known for its clifftop acropolis dating back to the 4th century. The Temple of Athena Lindia and the Castle of the Knights of St. John are among its notable landmarks. The village's whitewashed buildings house treasures like the Virgin Mary of Lindos Church with its 15th-century frescoes.
name: Lindos

excerpt: With origins dating back to the Bible, this scenic area features megalithic ruins & an aquarium.
detail_description: St. Paul's Bay is a picturesque area with historical significance, featuring megalithic ruins and an aquarium. The famous bay offers stunning views of the Aegean Sea and the coastline from its hilltop. The remains of a medieval fortified citadel and the ancient temple to Athena Lindia can still be seen, showcasing its great historical importance. The Acropolis of Lindos, overlooking St.
name: St Paul's Bay

excerpt: Popular beach in a cove featuring a long stretch of sand for swimming, sunbathing & boating.
detail_description: Lindos Beach is a popular destination located in a cove with a long stretch of sandy shoreline, perfect for swimming, sunbathing, and boating. It competes for attention with the ancient Acropolis of Lindos standing above it and the charming whitewashed houses cascading down the hillside. The beach offers fluffy yellow sand and clear waters ideal for families due to its shallow depth. Visitors can enjoy amenities such as bathrooms, showers, changing facilities, and sun loungers.
name: Lindos Beach

excerpt: Steep seating area of an ampitheater from the 4th century BC, linked to pagan festivals of the time.
detail_description: The Ancient Theatre of Lindos, dating back to the 4th century BC, is a significant historical site in Lindos. It was a bustling venue for various events and could accommodate up to 2,000 spectators. The theater features well-preserved rows of seating, a circular orchestral well, and a skillfully carved stage. Situated at the foot of Lindos Acropolis on the west slope, this ancient landmark offers impressive ruins and provides insight into life in ancient Greece.
name: Ancient Theatre of Lindos

detail_description: Perched on the highest point of Lindos, overlooking the Aegean Sea, the Church of the Holy Virgin (Panagia) is a remarkable historical and religious landmark. Dating back to the 14th century, this Greek Orthodox church showcases exquisite Byzantine architecture with its cruciform shape and central dome. Adorned with ancient frescoes and mosaics, it offers visitors a glimpse into its rich history. The adjacent courtyard provides stunning views of the towering campanile tower.
name: Church of the Holy Virgin (Panagia)

detail_description: Mavrikos is a renowned restaurant located in the charming village of Lindos, about 55 km from the center of Rhodes. Established in 1933 and currently managed by brothers Dimitris and Michalis Mavrikos, it has become a culinary institution known for its traditional Greek cuisine. The menu features dishes that highlight the freshest local produce, with an emphasis on sustainability and seasonality.
name: Mavrikos

detail_description: Pallas Beach in Lindos offers a serene and quieter alternative to the bustling main beaches. Visitors can rent colorful umbrellas and sun-beds, indulge in water sports, swim in the clear blue waters, or savor refreshing drinks and fresh seafood at beach tavernas. St. Paul's Bay nearby is known for its exceptional beauty and excellent snorkeling opportunities.
name: Pallas Beach

detail_description: The Tomb of Cleobulus the Lindian is a hidden gem in Lindos, offering a unique and off-the-beaten-path experience for travelers. The hike to the tomb provides stunning views of the sea and the village of Lindos. The path is marked by red stones, making it easily accessible, but sturdy shoes are recommended due to rough and rocky terrain.
name: Tomb of Cleobulus the Lindian

detail_description: Mythos All Day Restaurant is a charming eatery located in Lindos Main Square, offering breathtaking views of the Lindos Acropolis and the glimmering harbor. The restaurant's ambiance perfectly complements its surroundings, and its dishes are made using locally sourced produce, with most ingredients coming from Mythos's own farms. The menu features imaginative salads bursting with flavor, succulent octopus, battered squid, stuffed vine leaves, and grilled halloumi with ouzo and saffron.
name: Mythos All Day Restaurant
address: main square (Next ALFA BANK, Lindos, ΡΟΔΟΣ 851 07, Greece

detail_description: The Temple of Athena Lindia is a must-see attraction in the charming settlement of Lindos. Dating back to the 4th century BC, this ancient temple is located on the Acropolis, offering breathtaking panoramic views of the Aegean Sea. The site also features a Byzantine chapel and a Medieval Castle, creating a unique convergence of different historical eras.
name: Temple of Athena Lindia

detail_description: Ambrosia is a charming restaurant owned by George and his wife, Litsa, who designed the menu. The cozy atmosphere of the beautifully designed room, which was originally the family home, offers a quiet oasis from the bustling streets of the village. While it lacks a roof terrace, this adds to its charm. The Mediterranean-influenced eatery offers well-balanced tastes and textures in their Greek and Mediterranean dishes.
name: Ambrosia

detail_description: Nestled in the charming village of Lindos, the Lindos Ice Bar stands out as a unique gem among Europe’s thematic bars and is proudly the only one of its kind in Greece. Since its grand opening in August 2011, this frosty haven has captivated visitors with an extraordinary experience where you can sip on your favorite cocktails at a chilling -6 degrees Celsius, regardless of the sweltering heat outside.
name: Lindos Ice Bar

detail_description: Nestled in the enchanting village of Lindos, "Lindos By Night Bar" stands as a vibrant hub for nightlife enthusiasts. This iconic venue has been a staple since 1982, welcoming visitors from all walks of life to experience its lively atmosphere. With three distinct levels and an inviting rooftop terrace offering stunning views of the illuminated Acropolis, it’s the perfect spot to unwind with a cocktail as you soak in the breathtaking scenery.
name: Lindos By Night Bar

detail_description: Nestled in the charming village of Lindos, just a stone's throw from the bustling main street and a short stroll to stunning sandy beaches and the ancient Acropolis, Captains House Bar offers an enchanting escape. This traditional establishment is housed in a beautifully preserved 17th-century villa, showcasing high ceilings and stained glass windows that reflect its rich history. The bar's inviting courtyard creates an atmospheric setting perfect for unwinding with pre-dinner drinks while soaking up the local ambiance.
name: Captains House Bar

detail_description: Located just a mile outside of Lindos, abc Supermarket is a convenient option easily accessible by taxi or car rental. It offers a wide range of products at reasonable prices, making it a great alternative to the more touristy supermarkets in the area. Despite its odd layout with small rooms over multiple levels, it is known as one of the largest supermarkets in Lindos.
name: abc Supermarket

detail_description: Melia Cafe and Bakery is a charming spot located just before the town of Lindos. This cafe is renowned for its delicious American coffee and offers a variety of delectable options including sandwiches, pizza, salads, quiches, Greek specialties, ice cream, and cakes. Situated on a rooftop, it provides stunning views of the picturesque town. Visitors highly recommend trying their freddo cappuccinos and indulging in the delightful Greek yoghurt cheesecake or banoffee.
name: Melia

detail_description: Nestled just a short drive from the charming town of Lindos, Ktima Lindos is a hidden gem that promises an unforgettable dining experience. Perched atop a hill, this mountain-top restaurant boasts breathtaking views that are perfect for a romantic evening or special celebration. With outdoor seating alongside an infinity pool, guests can sip cocktails while soaking in panoramic sunset vistas illuminated by twinkling fairy lights as night falls.
name: Ktima Lindos
address: Right next to Lindos Mare hotel, Lindos 851 07, Greece

detail_description: Located in the heart of Lindos, Village Cafe is a charming snack bar and cafeteria offering a taste of Greek ease. With a variety of snacks and drinks, including options for vegetarians, vegans, and those with gluten-free diets, it's an ideal spot for a delicious breakfast or brunch. The cafe exudes the typical Lindian charm with its elegant yet simple ambiance.
name: Village Cafe Lindos

detail_description: Courtyard is a welcoming and friendly place in the town of Lindos. Offering panoramic views of the Fortress of Knights, the bar's terrace is a perfect spot to relax after exploring the town's many attractions.
name: Courtyard

excerpt: Clear, calm waters & sweeping coastal views are among the highlights at this quaint beach.
name: Paralia Agios Pavlos

detail_description: Head west and you'll stumble upon Paralia Glistra, a stunning beach with fine sand, shallow crystal-clear waters, and a cozy café. It's not overly crowded, offering ample space to relax under the shade or set up your spot on the sand. You can even rent large beds for group lounging. The cool bar area behind plays relaxing music, adding to the upscale vibe of this beach destination.
name: Paralia Glistra

excerpt: Popular beach with supporting restaurants & activity centers found between rocky headlands.
detail_description: Tsambika Beach is a popular destination on the island of Rhodes, offering a long stretch of golden sand between rocky headlands. The calm and shallow waters make it ideal for families to swim and play. The beach is well-organized with supporting facilities such as restaurants, sunbeds, and water sports centers. Accessible by public transport, this family-friendly outing provides opportunities for swimming, sunbathing, and enjoying refreshments from small snack bars.
name: Tsambika Beach

detail_description: Embark on the "Lindos By Boat" excursion, a leisurely cruise along Rhodes' coastline that offers a perfect blend of relaxation and discovery. As you sail, marvel at the stunning coves, caves, and beaches while soaking up the sun on deck. Take refreshing swim breaks in the crystal-clear waters. Upon reaching Lindos village, you'll have ample free time to wander through this medieval hamlet or savor a delightful lunch.
name: Lindos By Boat

detail_description: A friend in Rhodes organized a boat excursion with Lazy Day Lindos Rhodes, which turned out to be an amazing journey. The boat trip lasted most of the day and left us impressed. The captain, Dimitrios, was very friendly and accommodating. We made a few stops along the way to pick up passengers, but the main highlight was cruising along the coast near Lindos, offering breathtaking views of the acropolis.
name: Lazy day Lindos Rhodes

detail_description: Nestled in the bustling Central Square of Lindos, the Bust of Ioannis Zigdis stands as a tribute to this notable Greek politician born on July 21, 1913. Positioned conveniently next to a taxi station and bus stop, it attracts many tourists who are either arriving or waiting for their rides. Despite the hustle and bustle, visitors can enjoy stunning views of the bay and city from this spot. The area offers several seating options, some shaded for those seeking respite from the sun.
name: Bust of Ioannis Zigdis

detail_description: The Monument of Ioannis Zigdis stands proudly on a hill at the northern end of Lindos beach, commemorating the life of the local politician and economist. The location offers breathtaking panoramic views across the sea, coastline, village, and Acropolis, making it a must-visit spot especially during sunrise.
name: Monument of Ioannis Zigdis
